channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TX
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TX

item.title: Report E-2024040300
item.description:
Report E-2024040300

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-15T15:12:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-11
  • City: FOREST HILL
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LFW experienced a UN3098 NIL 8 release from a 2.5-gallon poly jerrican. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 0.5 cups of product released to a 1.5’ x 3” area of the trailer floor. The remaining material in the jug released into the poly bag/absorbents the pail was contained too prior to the crew’s arrival. The empty damaged jug, poly bag, absorbent and sodium bicarb were placed into a 55-gallon vented poly drum. The trailer floor was cleaned and neutralized with sodium bicarb. The impacted oil dri, neutralizer, impacted pallet wood, and poly 5-gallon pail which held the absorbents were placed into a second 55-gallon vented poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024040128
item.description:
Report X-2024040128

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-15T15:12:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-08
  • City: LAREDO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Aaron Gutierrez Operations supervisor called safety to report a spill of UN1759, CORROSIVE SOLIDS, N.O.S.(VENTAR D - THYMOL), 8, PG II on the dock. Aaron stated the pallet appears to be damaged by other freight (rubbing) causing the bag to tare and spill approximately 1lbs on the dock floor. Aaron s tated the spill was not noticed until reported to him while the pallet was setting on the dock at door 94. Aaron requested a cleaning crew to assist in cleaning up the spill.

item.title: Report E-2024040209
item.description:
Report E-2024040209

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-15T15:12:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-21
  • City: AVINGER
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CREEDENCE, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 143782
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: The driver of the vehicle was driving at approximately 60 mph when he felt a drop on the backend of the vehicle. At that time, the driver lost control of the vehicle and began to fishtail and then the vehicle rolled onto its top. A witness to the incident informed the driver that he had lost his back passenger wheels off the truck in transit and this caused the loss of control. It was determined that the wheel studs had completely broken off causing this to happen. The wreck and rollover are what caused the damage to the packaging of the chemicals. The duration of the release was approximately 45 minutes. Creedence immediately contacted an emergency response hazmat clean up crew and got them to the location of the incident. They immediately began containing the spill from spreading and cleaning what had been spilt. Creedence notified the National Response Center of the spill and TCEQ was on site directing the clean up the following day.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found in QA area at around 4;30 am. It seemed to have been dropped from the conveyor and broke the container inside. DescribePack: The container is cracked starting from the side of the cylinder, and trailing all the way down past the base to the bottom. the crack is about 2 feet long around container. Most of the contents leaked out. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: The container was found and put inside of a hazmat bag, and then put into a hazmat bin and set safely aside.

item.title: Report E-2024040289
item.description:
Report E-2024040289

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-15T15:12:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-12
  • City: ORANGE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 41500
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On March 12, 2024 at 1421 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Orange, Texas regarding the release of approximately (225) gallons of FERRIC SULFATE SOLUTION, Corrosive Liquid, Acidic, Inorganic, n.o.s. (UN3264, 8, III). Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors investigated and confirmed the release was caused by a load shift due to a hard brake and was contained to the trailer floor and a 100ft x 6ft area of asphalt trailing behind the unit. Contractors neutralized the release then used absorbents and the proper PPE to clean the release. Contractors were able to transfer the remaining product in the damaged tote to a new tote without complication. All waste generated from addressing this release was containerized in (7) 55-gallon DF’s, which was then taken offsite by contractors for proper disposal. **The NRC report has the city of Beaumont (which the spill took place in Orange City), this 5800 report was completed to match the NRC report for fluidity**

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-11T15:11:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-03
  • City: San Antonio
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 10000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 4, 2024 at 1610 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in San Antonio, Texas regarding (10) 330-gallon IBC plastic totes containing DCA-19002 (Environmentally hazardous substances, liquid, n.o.s) UN3082, 9, III, that was involved in a vehicular crash. Contractors arrived to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Contractors were able to collect the material from the totes using a vac truck and proper PPE. Contractors collected 1800 gallons of waste that was taken offsite for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024040174
item.description:
Report E-2024040174

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-11T15:11:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-02
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 2, 2024, one (1) 1-gallon pail of paint was crushed in transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the top of the pail. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. Terminal personnel deployed absorbents to the release, swept them in with hand tools and containerized all spent absorbents in one (1) 30-gallon drum. LSH personnel overpacked the one (1) damaged pail in the same 30-gallon drum. All waste was staged onsite for future disposal.

item.title: Report I-2024040018
item.description:
Report I-2024040018

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-10T15:11:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-08
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED AIRLINES HOLDINGS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Customer seated in 4L spilled drink on his lap top while open and on Computer worked for about 5 minutes and then screen began to flicker and then went completely black Customer turned off computer and closed it He then waited a few minutes and turned it back on The computer began smoking The smoke was white and had a strong odor FA passed by, noticed the smoke and took action FA advised the PAX to tum off the computer, he also notified the rest of the crew FA assisted FA Strang by retrieving the TCB and fire extinguisher FA stated no fire was visible during the situations Once the lap top was turned off smoke and odor slowly stopped Crew determined extinguisher was not necessary Computer was placed in TCB which was closed and sealed and placed on floor of 4r lavatory

item.title: Report E-2024040120
item.description:
Report E-2024040120

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-09T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-04
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LDA experienced a UN1993 Rain-X Deicer -25 Degree Windshield Washer Fluid release from a 55-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 15-gallons of product released to a 7’ x 4’ area of the trailer floor and a 10’ x 23’ area of the concrete lot below due to a forklift puncture. The damaged drum was placed into a 95-gallon poly overpack. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. All impacted absorbents were then collected into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024040112
item.description:
Report E-2024040112

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-09T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-03
  • City: EL PASO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-LEP contacted ERTS regarding a box containing (2) 1-gallon jugs of Blue Whale Muriatic Acid that were punctured by a forklift and leaking 2-gallons of product onto the concrete dock floor. A Contractor neutralized the release using Soda Ash and cleaned the spill with Oil Dry. Two drums of waste were generated for disposal. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were impacted by this incident.
